snippet: In a move unthinkable not long ago, Parliament has voted to erect a statue of João Bernardo Vieira, a tempestuous leader whose killing is unsolved.
abstract: Bissau Journal; Parliament in Guinea-Bissau votes to erect statue of Pres Joao Bernardo Vieira, whose unsolved murder in 2009 became taboo topic under subsequent military rule; speculation is widespread that Vieira's enemies in military plotted his killing, but civilian government that now runs country is making possible a commemoration that was once unthinkable.
lead_paragraph: In a move unthinkable not long ago, Parliament has voted to erect a statue of João Bernardo Vieira, a tempestuous leader whose killing is unsolved.

headline.print_headline: Six Years After Murder, an Autocrat Makes a Posthumous Comeback
headline.main: Six Years After Murder, Guinea-Bissau Autocrat Makes a Posthumous Comeback

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
